intro: Acosta jaennensis, commonly known as the Jaén acosta, is a flowering plant species native to the arid regions of southern South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
